title: Save Aarey Forest:Aarey Is Known As 'Chota Kashmir', Now It Has Become Like One: Netizens After Section 144 Imposition

Aarey Is Known As 'Chota Kashmir', Now It Has Become Like One: Netizens After Section 144 Imposition

Aarey Is Known As 'Chota Kashmir', Now It Has Become Like One: Netizens After Section 144 Imposition

Protests are erupting both online and offline after the Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MMRCL) began cutting of hundreds of trees in the Aarey Colony where a proposed car shed is to be set up.

The MMRCL began the cutting of trees on Friday night to clear the land.

But the action has not gone down well with the environmentalists who had been campaigning to save the greenery, often referred to as the lungs of Mumbai.

As the protests began gaining momentum there was a massive deployment of police to blockade the area and Section 144 has been imposed there.

#SaveAarey A great salute to those who stood for these trees. If trees can speak, they would curse us for generations. Time to take all those who support this car shed on #Aarey colony to elementary school. Don't give up. Let's raise our voice even louder than before. #fayedsouza pic.twitter.com/hYmjFnL2dV — Jayakumar (@ngu_jay) October 5, 2019

⁦When the Govt conducts Surgical Strikes on Mumbai’s lungs itself! Well done 😭#SaveAarey #SaveAareyForest pic.twitter.com/p2AXtow0ig — Abhivyakti Group (@AbhivyaktiGroup) October 5, 2019

Don't Miss 684 SHARES 452 SHARES 4.7 K SHARES 168 SHARES

SECTION 144 IMPOSED.

WHAT DO U VALUE MORE, MUMBAI?BREATHS OR METRO?#SaveAarey pic.twitter.com/BCINOT3f6S — Brishti Chanda (@ChandaBrishti) October 5, 2019

We are expediting our extinction!

In a city prone to floods during monsoon rains and at a time when #ClimateStrike has captured global narrative, it is painful to see 2646 trees being cut in #AareyForest, considered Mumbai's green lung and home to 30 tribal villages.#SaveAarey pic.twitter.com/IJxjIglrAm — Anupam | अनुपम (@AnupamConnects) October 4, 2019

Hundreds of Mumbaikars have gathered to stop the massacre of #AareyForest and facing the wrath of the police.

Where's @AUThackeray who promised that he won't allow cutting down even a single tree?#SaveAarey pic.twitter.com/zbaHOLa0LW — Abhijeet Dipke (@abhijeet_dipke) October 4, 2019

Update: Aarey activists including young students, women & housewives have been lathicharged TWICE by the police.

Authorities have already started cutting trees in Aarey after the order passed by the BHC today. Citizens are reaching Aaarey forest to stop this. The @ShivSena ‘s @sheetalmhatre1 ji & Shubha Raul ji at Aarey. Even @prabhu_suneel ji has been standing up for it with the citizens. Some 2600 trees in Aarey Colony as set to be cut down to clear land for the construction of a car shed as part of the Mumbai Metro project.
